technology.short_description: Many herds of fine Elven steeds roam freely on Ulthuan's wide plains, but can be called to battle when needed.

effects.description: Speed: +5% for Chariot units
Speed: +5% for Ellyrian Reavers, Silver Helms and Dragon Princes units

technology.short_description: Only when there is dire need can the most ancient examples be roused from their slumber.

effects.description: Upkeep: -4% for Dragons and Merwyrm units
Recruitment cost: -6% for Dragons and Merwyrm units

technology.short_description: The renowned smiths of Vaul and Hoeth forge greatswords so light and well-balanced they appear to be no lighter than a feather.

effects.description: Armour-piercing weapon damage: +3 for Phoenix Guard, Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace and Dragon Princes units

technology.short_description: In solemn witnesses to a dwindling race, the Ten Kingdoms’ armouries contain more enchanted armaments than there are Elves to wield them.

effects.description: Missile strength: +5% for Archers, Lothern Sea Guard, Shadow Warriors and Shadow-walker units

technology.short_description: Having a surplus of the finest building materials says something about a society's inherent wealth.

effects.description: Construction cost: -8% for all buildings

technology.short_description: "Pain, begone, I will have no more of thee!"

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +3%

technology.short_description: Ithilmar is an unusual substance in that it offers full protection but without the encumbrance of a full suit of plate armour.

Speed: +5% for Spearmen, Archers, Ship's Company, Lothern Sea Guard, Rangers, Silverin Guard, Sisters of Avelorn, Shadow Warriors and Shadow-walker units

technology.short_description: The cadence of military music enables the maintenance of order and discipline in the fray's desperate, blood-soaked moments.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Ship's Company, Lothern Sea Guard, Archers, Silverin Guard, Rangers, Spearmen, Shadow-Warriors and Shadow-walker units

technology.short_description: The forgemasters of the Dragon Spine have laboured through centuries to perfect intricacies unseen by the fleeting races of the world.

Recruit rank: +1 for Archers, Silverin Guard, Rangers, Spearmen, Shadow-Warriors and Shadow-walker units

technology.short_description: Wide, flat-headed arrows are both easy to store and more effective at slicing through massed ranks of the foe than standard designs.

technology.short_description: Only the very best blades are made from star-metal; only Dwarfen gromril comes close in hardness and strength.

Weapon strength: +5% for White Lions of Chrace, Swordmasters of Hoeth and Phoenix Guard units

technology.short_description: Just as the citizen levy hones their sword hand, so too does courtly intrigue sharpen the keen minds of Ulthuan nobility for statecraft.

effects.description: Hero action cost: -15%
Hero action success chance: +5%

technology.short_description: Research the following items to advance the High Elves' prosperous economy to a higher level altogether.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +5 with all factions

technology.short_description: More than a Sea Patrol’s fable, the discipline of the Ship’s Company is a tangible display of clockwork precision in a drilled, tight-knit crew.

technology.short_description: Expecting succour, supplicants of Ladrielle – protectress of lost travellers in the wilds or upon the waves – often carry trinkets bearing her featureless visage.

effects.description: gives RoR's the benefits of aislinn tech for +1 melee defense per rank effect, because they don't have ranks.
Melee defence: +1 per rank for Ship's Company units

technology.short_description: "It will not take long before prayers to Mathlann find their way to your lips more readily than Kurnous or Asuryan."

technology.short_description: In the navy standards are everything and all those amongst the ranks of the Sea Patrol need the latest equipment.

All Archers will be upgraded to Archers (Light Armour)

technology.short_description: To rouse the fire of Asurian intensity is to command obedience – be they white-garbed neophytes or Nagarythe's black-fletched ranks.

Leadership: +3 for Ship's Company, Lothern Sea Guard, Archers, Silverin Guard, Rangers, Spearmen, Shadow-Warriors and Shadow-walker units

Reload time reduction: +5% for Archers, Lothern Sea Guard, Shadow Warriors and Shadow-walkers units

technology.short_description: One of the most impressive, iconic sights of an Elven warhost is the wall of spears, perfectly arranged for maximum effect.

effects.description: Melee defence: +4 for Spearmen, Lothern Sea Guard and Silverin Guard units

technology.short_description: All citizens of Ulthuan must join a militia and attend regular training, by order of the Phoenix King.

technology.short_description: Idols of Mathlann's monstrous spawn often accompany the rites of superstitious Asur. Scales of Amanar they might not be, but their efficacy borders on the uncanny.
